t: A song of ascents. Of David.
I*pn rejoiced with those who said to me, “Let’s*ln go to the house of the Lord.”*s
Our*ln feet were standing within*ln your gates, Jerusalem—
Jerusalem,*pn built as a city should be, solidly*ln united,
where*ln the tribes, the Lord’s*s tribes, go up to*ln give thanks to the name of the Lord.*s (This*ln is an ordinance for Israel.)
There,*ln thrones for judgment are placed, thrones*ln of the house of David.
Pray*pn for the well-being of Jerusalem: “May*ln those who love you be secure;
may*ln there be peace within your walls, security*ln within your fortresses.”
Because*ln of my brothers and friends, I*ln will say, “May peace be in you.”
Because*ln of the house of the Lord*s our God, I*ln will pursue your prosperity.
